Proc¶

class game.proc.GameProcessor(matrix: numpy.ndarray, left: int, top: int, step: int)¶

Class responsible for converting user clicks to changed cells on a nonogram grid.

Parameters

  • matrix (np.ndarray) – Initial matrix that represents a nonogram

  • left (int) – left indent of the nonogram rectangle on the screen

  • top (int) – top indent of the nonogram rectangle on the screen

  • step (int) – one cell width

change_cell(i: int, j: int, button: int) → numpy.ndarray¶

Change cell with indices [i][j] based on which mouse button was clicked.

Parameters

  • i (int) – i index of the cell to change

  • j (int) – j index of the cell to change

  • button (int) – mouse button type

Returns

changed matrix

Return type

nd.array

click(x: int, y: int) → Tuple[int, int]¶

If clicked on a cell return its indices, else return None.

Parameters

  • x (int) – x coordinate of a mouseclick

  • y (int) – y coordinate of a mouseclick

Returns

Tuple of cell indicies if clicked on a cell, else return None

Return type

Tuple[int, int] or None
